conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic fields B1 and B2.
The particle moves in a circular path due to the Lorentz force in each magnetic field.
Determine the radius of the circular path in B1: r1 = mv/qB1.
Determine the radius of the circular path in B2: r2 = mv/qB2.
Determine the period of the circular motion in B1: T1 = 2πm/qB1.
Determine the period of the circular motion in B2: T2 = 4πm/qB1.
Calculate the time to complete a semicircle in B1: t1 = πm/qB1.
Calculate the time to complete a semicircle in B2: t2 = 2πm/qB1.
The total time to return to point O is t = t1 + t2 = 3πm/qB1.
The particle will pass through point O downward again after a time of 3πm/qB1.
